titleInfo.title: 'Miscellaneous notes: Mr Aitchison and Capt. Baring'

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: The file has been foliated using a pencil number enclosed in a circle located in the top right hand corner of the recto of each folio.

mods.abstract: The correspondence focuses primarily on the Government of Bombay's handling of affairs in Baroda and their failure to reprimand Colonel Robert Phayre for his behaviour; the Government of India having taken over the managing of Baroda affairs and the Governor of Bombay, Sir Philip Wodehouse's dislike of the way in which his Government had been treated and kept in the dark over decisions relating to the state.Other correspondence includes a detailed discussion of the Opium trade and methods of tackling smuggling that had been occurring, particularly near coastal and river areas; issues surrounding the security of letters and telegrams being sent between Pelly and the Government of India; and a death threat made to key individuals, including Pelly, involved in the decision to depose Malharrao, Gaekwar of Baroda.
